alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 30 at 2:21PM MDT until August 30 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, AND 317... .Critical fire weather conditions have developed across the northeastern Wyoming plains. RHs in the single digits and wind gusts of up to 40 mph have been observed by multiple stations in southern Campbell and Weston Counties. Critical fire weather conditions will be expected to persist into the evening with winds dying down and relative humidities recovering after sunset. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, AND 317... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell and 317 Weston County Plains. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains
